intro: [WRONG START] Arctium pestalozzaa, commonly known as the Pestalozza burdock, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces purple to pink flower heads that resemble small umbrellas, typical of the dandelion family. Its roots are thick and fibrous, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Native to Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in meadows.
